I explored both frontend and backend development, and discovered that I enjoy building interfaces and user experiences the most. Although I started with Java, today I work mainly with JavaScript, React, and modern web tools. I enjoy creating useful, scalable, and visually pleasing applications, and Iâ€™m constantly learning to expand my skills.

music.title: Music
music.description: Music has been one of my passions for over 20 years. I play guitar and compose my own songs, and I believe creativity and discipline are values that connect both music and programming. This passion inspired me to build TuneBridge, a platform for musicians to connect, share, and collaborate.

projects.title: Projects
projects.subtitle: Here are some of the most relevant projects I've built.

vestigio.title: Vestigio Restauraciones
vestigio.description: Official website for a furniture restoration business, designed and developed from scratch to build brand identity and increase online presence.
vestigio.webDescription: Built with HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript. Hosted on GitHub Pages with a custom domain and Google Analytics integration.

tunebridge.title: TuneBridge
tunebridge.description: Social network for musicians and music professionals, aimed at facilitating connections, collaborations, and showcasing creative work.
tunebridge.webDescription: Full-stack app built with React, Vite, Tailwind CSS, Supabase, i18next, and React Query. Includes authentication, user profiles, posts, likes, comments, chat, and music sharing.

certificates.title: Certificates
certificates.subtitle: A collection of technical certifications and courses I've completed.
certificates.description: The certificates correspond to courses completed on Coursera in various areas related to web development and programming. These courses have allowed me to acquire and strengthen knowledge in frontend, backend, and modern tools for application development.
certificates.webDescription: This project, developed with React.js and Tailwind CSS, neatly showcases my Coursera certificates. I used JSON to organize the data in a clear and scalable way, making updates easy. The design is minimalist, prioritizing readability and smooth navigation.
